action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia marked as Active

full_threads.body:
Hi Wolfiq,

We have previously been working with Chris on updates to our website for Dr Ganesh Shiva however we just received his out of office that he no longer works with you. Is there someone from the team who can assist us with the below updates?

Kind Regards,
Laura

Laura


Business Manager

Dr Ganesh Shiva

Neurosurgeon



(02) 9159 3944
laura@drshiva.com.au
https://drshiva.com.au/
Suite 1, Level 1 41/43 Goulburn St, Liverpool NSW 2170





---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Laura @ Dr Shiva Neurosurgery <laura@drshiva.com.au>
Date: Tue, Nov 19, 2024 at 1:17 PM
Subject: update for Ganesh Shiva website
To: Ganesh Shiva <ganesh@drshiva.com.au>, <chris@wolfiq.com.au>


Hi Chris,

Aologies for the delay in getting back to you. Thanks for your suggestions.

Could we please look at the following to update the website with this new award:

1. Placement of the award + brief blurb on the homepage. e.g. could we have the title 'Research Award', a photo tile of the presentation title slide and then the text 'Dr Ganesh Shiva was awarded the Jenepher Martin Surgical Education Research Prize at the 2024 Annual Scientific Congress (ASC) in Ōtautahi Christchurch. He received the award in recognition of his research on lumbar microdiscectomy competency-based training.'

2. A new 'heading' on the 'About' page under 'Neurosurgery Research Contributions' titled 'Neurosurgery Awards'. This will link to a new page with some of the detail and photos from the RACS profile.
E.g.
Dr Ganesh Shiva, receipeint of the Jenepher Martin Surgical Education Research Prize

Dr Ganesh Shiva was awarded the Jenepher Martin Surgical Education Research Prize at the 2024 Annual Scientific Congress (ASC) in Ōtautahi Christchurch. Dr Shiva is recognised for furthering surgical education with his research focused on lumbar microdiscectomy competency-based training. He was awarded the prize for the best reseach paper presented at the ASC. The award is presented to encourage surgical education research in Australia and Aotearoa New Zealand. "It is a real honour and privilege to have won the Jenepher Martin Prize this year for a paper related to competency-based training. I hope that my research goes some way towards further developing and enhancing competency-based training in Neurosurgery," Dr Shiva says. He was selected by a panel of expert judges for his paper titled Developing an objective assessment of performance for lumbar microdiscectomy: Delphi methodology. [Authors: Dr Ganeshwaran Shivapathasundram, Dr Pramudith Sirimanna, Associate Professor Sarah Aitken, and Professor Vasikaran Naganathan]. The judges praised the paper, noting its maturity of thinking, substantial education research potential, and strong methodological approach.

Hopefully this makes sense but if not happy to discuss further

Regards,
Laura


---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Chris Paradowski <chris@wolfiq.com.au>
Date: Thu, 29 Aug 2024 at 4:03 PM
Subject: Re: Update for GP's from Sydney Southwest Private Hospital
To: Laura O'Carrigan <laura.ocarrigan@gmail.com>
Cc: Ganesh Shiva <ganesh@drshiva.com.au>


Hi Laura,

Thanks and likewise. Congratulations to Ganesh!

Are there any assets that were shared? E.g. photos, blurb on the prize etc.

Ultimately, it depends on how much you would like to prioritise the award.

A less obvious placement could be on the about page: (screenshot below)


A higher-importance placement could be on the homepage: (screenshot below)


If you have a series of photos and a reasonable write-up, we can create a page for it. You and Ganesh will be best placed to determine how important the recognition is, we'll help get it where you need it.

This link appears to have enough content for a dedicated page: https://www.surgeons.org/surgicalnews/Articles/2024/Volume-25/Issue-4/Dr-Ganesh-Shiva

I hope this helps,

Chris Paradowski

Partnerships Manager

Wolf IQ Pty Ltd
1300 072 134 | 0421 859 547
chris@wolfiq.com.au
wolfiq.com.au
Level 2, 383 George Street, Sydney NSW 2000

Regards
Laura
